'''''Fountain of Belleau''''' is the first [[Fontaine]] Chapter [[soundtrack]] album.

It features a total of 96 tracks produced by the HOYO-MiX team. The album is divided into four discs: ''Chanson of Justice and Impartiality''; ''Arioso of Belle Epoque''; ''Chapelloise of Trickling Springs''; and ''La bataille de Fontaine''. Selected pieces were performed by the London Symphony Orchestra and folk artists. The recordings took place at various studios including Abbey Road Studios, Angel Studios, Air-Edel Recording Studios, and Air-Edel Recording Studio.

The album was first announced on September 15, 2023, during the [[Special Program]] for [[Version 4.1]]. The tracklist was announced on September 29 and the album was later released on October 2.<ref>Sina Weibo: [https://weibo.com/6593199887/4951278720911082 {{zh|「《原神》枫丹篇OST即将上线 」}}]</ref>

==Trivia==
* ''{{w|Arioso}}'' also ''Aria Parlante'' is a category of solo vocal piece, usually occurring in an opera or {{w|Oratorio|oratorio}}, falling somewhere between {{w|Recitative|recitative}} and in {{w|Aria|aria}} style. 
* {{Fr|{{w|Belle Époque}}|tl=The Beautiful Era}} was a period of French and European history that began after the end of the {{w|Franco-Prussian War}} in 1871 and continued until the outbreak of World War I in 1914.
* ''{{w|Chapelloise}}'' or ''Belgijka'' is a traditional {{w|Folk dance|folk dance}} with change of partners (a so-called {{W|Mixer dance|Mixer}}), belonging to the standard repertoire of a {{w|Balfolk|Bal folk}}.
* {{Fr|La bataille de Fontaine}} is French for "the battle of Fontaine."
